Title: Site Reliability Engineer I
RoleDescription:
Who We Are:
Wayfair leads e-commerce for all things home, driven by modern tech. We seek sharp thinkers who design scalable systems while keeping a startup mindset. Our culture values fast, data-driven innovation.
The Wayfair Operations Center team is looking for experienced engineers skilled in cloud-native design, legacy maintenance, and SRE best practicesplus ideas for improvement! We collaborate across our Technology organization to ensure platforms and services are production-ready, contributing to both platform and software codebases.

As a Site Reliability Engineer, you will join our team to help grow our systems into best-in-class for efficiency, stability, observability, velocity, and scale in the e-commerce space, engage with the product and engineering team from Day 1 to design, build and maintain the system/software proactively.
Influence the design and architecture of Wayfair system as part of our Cloud Enablement journey while maintaining our critical pieces of legacy tools; collaborate with development teams to design scalable and reliable systems, considering aspects such as fault tolerance, availability and performance.

Design experience with distributed systems, microservices architecture, and related technologies.
Strong understanding of monitoring and alerting, with a focus on performance monitoring and tracing instrumentation & SLI/SLO/SLAs.
Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and version control systems (e.g., Buildkite, Github Actions, Gitlab CI/CD).
Knowledge of configuration management tools (e.g. Puppet, Ansible, Chef, Terraform).
Excellent communication skills across engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders alike.
Passion for leading a large, cross-cutting technical initiative to delivery, cross-functional consensus building and influencing design decisions.
Ample experience gathering and balancing requirements from technical and business stakeholders, and reaching consensus on prioritization.
Experience mentoring engineers and leading code reviews.
Proven track record decoupling monolith services is a plus.

Excellent communication skills with demonstrated experience driving teams forward and ability to influence results

Distributed microservice architectures with well architected domain boundaries

Head of Product, Data & AI
Who You Are: 
 
Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. These experiences are driven by a cutting-edge set of data and machine learning, analytics, and operational systems that work in an integrated fashion to deliver a world class shopping experience for our customers. Business applications of these systems span many fields including recommendations, marketing, supply chain optimization and merchandising. These fields require a sophisticated technology stack that allows for configurability for rapid testing and exploration. 
 
We are looking for a seasoned Product leader to join our Platforms Product team to lead a team of Product Managers working on multiple facets of our Data and AI Platforms, including real-time, batch, analytics, and also Generative AI capabilities. These platforms are leveraged by nearly all our employees for operational and analytical purposes, or for powering our AI applications geared towards internal processes and our customer and supplier experiences.
 
Were looking for someone who not only enjoys creating a bold vision, but also executing on their ideas through fruition on a global scale. In this role, you will own a range of products that will offer cloud native Data & AI capabilities to our Engineers, Analysts, and Data Scientists developing customer and supplier-focused platforms. Your goal will be to empower any team across the company with self-service software (with data or AI needs) to deploy, manage, and integrate their applications utilizing our data platforms.
 
This person will act with a high degree of freedom and ownership, setting platform vision, forming strong relationships with senior cross-functional partners (both technical and non-technical), aligning on a shared vision for success, and delivering results that create meaningful business impact. This Product leader will serve as the subject matter expert, drive adoption for new use cases, and continually improve our platform capabilities. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in product management, a deep understanding of data technologies, and a proven track record of leading and developing high-performing teams.

Team Management: Lead, mentor, and manage a team of Product Managers, creating an integrated strategy across your products, fostering a culture of collaboration, measurement and creating space to learn and improve.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including Engineering, Data Science, Analytics, and other key stakeholders to ensure our data platforms meet their needs and drive business value.
Market Analysis: Stay abreast of industry trends and competitive landscape to inform product decisions and identify opportunities for innovation and improvement.
Product Metrics: Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of data platform products and drive continuous improvement.
Driving adoption and value realization: Market your product internally to various departments to ensure all available users know about your product and how they could value from it
Communication: Articulate product vision, strategy, and roadmap to internal and external stakeholders, ensuring transparency and alignment across the organization. Maintain a product vision and roadmap, keeping stakeholders and constituents up to date on the top level goals and timelines

7+ years of experience in product management, with at least 3 years in a leadership role overseeing data and/or AI platforms
5+ years of product experience in developing data-driven products that are cloud native 
Strong understanding of data movement technologies (batch and real-time), Data Lakes, analytical data systems, GenAI tools and applying models to real-world problems.
Strong written and verbal communication and a demonstrated ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences

Title: Software Engineer II, Customer Technology
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who we are 
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently. 
Wayfair's Search and Recommendations team builds the core platforms and services that allow our customers to discover & buy the products they love. Just last year alone our team has contributed to hundreds of millions in incremental revenue. We do this by leveraging Wayfair's extensive customer and product data to deliver trusted and valuable recommendations in real-time using custom machine learning models. We productionalize these ML models as microservices and build data pipelines necessary for inference and model training.
Our platforms and services are used to power experiences for search, browse across multiple  storefront and marketing channels and are called over a billion times a day. 
We're looking for an experienced senior software engineer to join our highly impactful team to help us build and extend our Predictive Search Service. A Software Engineer will be responsible for high quality implementation and consistent maintenance of systems that support auto-complete search behavior on Wayfair's sites. We have ambitious goals to improve this search functionality to better understand customer intent and map them to the most relevant products and searches on site.
What you will do:

Work with a broader highly collaborative cross-functional team that includes product managers, data scientists, and analysts.
Work with a variety of technologies, including Java, Spark, Kafka, Aerospike, Hadoop, Airflow, RESTful web services, gRPC, Kubernetes. Additionally, youll work with various managed GCP offerings like BigQuery, Composer and Vertex AI.
Build platforms and services that allow us to make realtime ML powered decisions that improve the customers onsite search experience.
Deliver direct measurable results for our business and customers through improved product recommendations.
Mentor junior engineers to develop the next generation of Wayfair engineering.
Provide high quality code and technical design reviews.
Contribute to the code base, with a mind to best practices and an equally high degree of autonomy.

What you will need

A Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related engineering discipline.
3-5 years of experience in a modern programming language, preferably Java 
Knowledge of scalable distributed systems with deep understanding of object oriented design and design patterns.
Knowledge of designing APIs and microservices.
Experience working on cloud technologies specifically GCP is a plus.
Experience with Lucene-based Search engines like Elasticsearch is a plus.
Knowledge of recommendation systems and productionalizing ML models is a plus.
Experience using Kubernetes, Docker, Buildkite, and Terraform for containerization and CI/CD is a plus.
Excellent communication skills and ability to work effectively with engineers, product managers, data scientists, analysts and business stakeholders.

Exceptional analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills, with a proven ability to interpret complex data and translate it into actionable strategies.
Advanced proficiency in Excel for complex data modeling, analysis, and reporting is essential.
Superior communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills, with a demonstrated ability to build strong relationships, influence senior leaders, and effectively negotiate.
Proven track record of managing multiple, complex projects independently in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
Experience with Workday or other major HRIS systems.

Title: Full Time Furniture Sales Associate + Key Holder for AllModern (A Wayfair Specialty Brand)
RoleDescription:
Full Time Furniture Sales Associate + Key Holder for AllModern (A Wayfair Specialty Brand)
Come join the team that is reinventing home! Wayfair is hiring for our AllModern retail store! If you are looking for rapid growth, constant learning and dynamic challenges, this store  might be the future home for your career.
The base pay for this position is $24.50 per hour.
What youll do:

Engage and connect with customers and drive sales by asking thoughtful questions to understand their needs and style, guiding them through their questions, and providing the best options for their homes.
Support associates to help drive exceptional customer service and maintain a strong visible presence in the designated work area to drive sales and foster a great customer experience.
Support Store Leaders to train and develop associates on knowledge of our product, proper selling behavior, customer engagement, as well operations, visual, and other aspects of their roles.
Along with the Store Manager, provide helpful observational feedback and thoughtful guidance to Sales Associates to aid them to adapt and grow within their roles.
Deliver and drive individual and team sales and service KPIs, productivity standards and store goals by providing coaching and support to the Sales team.
Lead the use of utilization design tools, CRM software and client accounts for consistent customer experience and record keeping.  
Master selling essentials, sales analytics tools, and other training resources to educate the team on our wide array of product assortment. 
Depending on the specific work shift, this associate will help open and/or close the store, with keyholder responsibilities. Opening and closing regularly. 
Manage and monitor stock levels, merchandise presentations, signing, and assortment in all departments to ensure the sales-floor is adequately stocked. Maintain visual, cleanliness, and safety standards of the store and back of house.
Engage in a high energy and dynamic work environment where there can be rapid changes in products, promotions, offerings and operations.

What youll need:

2+ years experience motivating and coaching a team to achieve sales goals (preferably as a store Leader or Trainer).
Passion for great customer service and a drive to exceed sales targets.
Strong sales, organization, self-motivation, communication and relationship management skills.
An ability to handle customer escalations and demonstrate professional maturity
Demonstrated ability to work within a team sales environment.
Strong technical acumen to learn necessary software and hardware; proficiency in Google. Suites and/or Microsoft Office applications, as well as proficiency in operating tablets and POS systems.
Track record of thriving in a fast paced and changing environment, with an ability to adapt and grow.
Ability to work a flexible schedule, including nights, weekends, and holidays.

 

Able to speak, read and comprehend English to ensure your safety and the safety of those working around you.

 
Physical Requirements:

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand, walk, talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to sit; regularly climb or balance; and frequently stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must regularly, frequently or occasionally lift and/or move up to 75 lbs with assistance.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.

Compensation & Benefits:

Medical benefits, financial benefits, and a generous employee discount

Title: Upholstery Sales Specialist
RoleDescription:
ROLE: Upholstery Category Sales Specialist
Overview:We are seeking highly motivated sales professionals with a strong technical background to join our category sales team, specializing in the Upholstery market. In this role, you'll leverage your expertise to drive exceptional sales results through meaningful customer interactions. Your ability to understand and communicate complex product features will be key in helping customers make informed purchasing decisions and achieve your sales goals. If you love to connect with customers and help them find and purchase amazing products, then Wayfair may be the perfect place for the next steps in your career!Quick Highlights:

Full-Time Position
Compensation: $16/hour + Monthly Bonus potential
*Weekends Required*

Schedules are subject to change periodically
Note: This is a remote Sales specific role, and is NOT Customer Service based.
What Does a Category Sales Specialist Do?

Grow and Leverage Sales Expertise: Use your deep product knowledge and strong sales skills to help Wayfair customers navigate purchases within the applicable category. 
Meet a High Performance Bar: Meet or exceed your monthly revenue, calls per day targets, and/or other established KPIs in alignment with business expectations. 
Influence Sales: Utilize and expand your skills in selling products in a high growth and technical category through creative offerings and impactful initiatives.
Engage Customers: You will communicate with inbound customers as well as outbound follow ups for specialized category sales inquiries, working to create a positive customer experience from start to finish.
Adapt to Rapid Change: Engage in a high-energy, focused, and dynamic work environment where there can be quick pivots in our products, promotions, offerings, and operations.
Collaborate Effectively: Youll bring a willingness to share your innovative ideas and solutions to help make Wayfair a first in class customer experience.
Continuously Learn: Grow through Wayfairs world class training and continuous career development opportunities Youll be trained on our offerings, software, processes and supplier capabilities.
Act as a Brand Ambassador: Embody the Wayfair People Principles as a North Star in all your work to provide a first class customer experience. Exemplify a positive and professional attitude on a daily basis with customers and your team members.

 
What are the Requirements?

Sales Experience: 1 - 3 years of previous sales experience with demonstrated success in meeting or exceeding KPIs or performance metrics. (Previous technical category sales experience is highly preferred.)  
Category Knowledge: sales knowledge, strong business acumen, and ability to use your expertise to assist customers through their purchasing needs.
Adaptability: You must have a willingness to adapt and grow in a fast paced, high growth industry. 
Technical Proficiency: Comfort with learning new tools or systems and previous experience with Google, Microsoft office or other email platforms, video conferencing, multiple screens, spreadsheets, etc.
Internet Speed Requirements: Ability to maintain internet speeds of 25mbps (download) and 5+ (upload) to support voice traffic and HTTPS web traffic. You must be hardwired, no wifi permitted.
Training: Wayfair wants to ensure your success, this is why our sales training is 100% mandatory. We are unable to accommodate any absences, time off, or tardiness during this initial time frame.
Private Workspace:  This is a work from home position where you will be working virtually. A private and dedicated workspace free of any distractions (roommates, children, spouses, pets, etc.) or noise (radio, tv, etc.) Wayfair will provide the equipment needed.
Education: Bachelors degree or college diploma equivalent is preferred, but not required.
Effective Communications: Strong command of written and verbal communications to drive your performance.
Multitasking Ability: Capable of handling multiple conversations or customers simultaneously while maintaining an excellent customer experience.

What are the Benefits?

Insurance: Wayfair offers Health, Dental, and Vision Insurances starting on Day 1!
Time Off Options: You will start accruing PTO immediately, 7 paid federal holidays, 1 floating holiday, paid/unpaid parental leave options, and more.
401(k): Wayfair offers 401k savings with company match up to 4%.
Employee Discount: Youll receive a dynamic Wayfair discount for use on items you wish to purchase for your own space.
Bonuses: There will be bonus incentives based on performance against sales metrics
Sales Contests: SPIFFs and contests for additional earning potential
Tuition Reimbursement: Full-Time Employees who have worked at Wayfair for at least six months are eligible to receive tuition reimbursement for pre-approved courses from an accredited, post-secondary institution up to a maximum of $5,250 per year.
Referral Bonus: Know great talent? Wayfair offers a referral bonus for each of your eligible referrals that are hired ($500 per eligible referral)
Collaborative and Inclusive Environment: Enjoy a collaborative work environment and team culture.

Title: Senior Associate, Global Partner Support Platform Programs
RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $83,500-92,500 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. 
Do you thrive working at the intersection of technology and operations? Are you passionate about leveraging new technology and AI to drive operational excellence and efficiency? If so, join Wayfairs Global Partner Support (GPS) Platform Programs team as a Senior Associate!
Our team is responsible for improving partner support operations for Wayfairs suppliers, carriers, and customers by driving technology and process enhancements. This team collaborates closely with product management, engineering, and support teams to implement scalable solutions that enhance the supplier experience. We execute strategic initiatives that enhance supplier support through new software system capabilities, platform migrations, and AI-powered solutions. In this role, you will drive high-impact projects that improve support processes for over 20,000+ suppliers worldwide.
Youll be instrumental in shaping tech-driven enhancements, optimizing automation, and driving digital transformationensuring that Wayfair remains an industry leader in supplier support innovation.
What You'll Do:

Lead Tech Projects: Spearhead large-scale, cross-functional technology projects, including platform migrations and system upgrades, in close collaboration with product, engineering, and operations teams.
Drive Automation & AI Initiatives: Identify and implement AI-driven enhancements and automation opportunitiesfrom sentiment analysis to workflow optimizationto improve efficiency and the partner experience.
Optimize Processes: Analyze support trends and leverage data to refine support workflows, enhance ticketing systems, and improve self-service capabilities.
Manage Strategic Execution: Define project roadmaps, manage milestones, and track KPIs to measure the business impact of your initiatives, ensuring on-time and high-quality delivery.

What You'll Need:

Bachelor's degree
2-3 years of experience in technical project management, consulting, operations, or a similar technology-focused role.
Proven ability to lead cross-functional projects, influence stakeholders, and make data-driven decisions.
Experience collaborating with product management and software development teams to deliver technical solutions.
Familiarity with AI-powered solutions, automation, or digital transformation in a support or operational context. A background in customer service technology is a strong plus.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to work autonomously in a fast-paced environment, managing multiple priorities.
Experience with Atlassian tools (Jira, Confluence) and a background in supplier/vendor management environments are preferred.

All Boston-based interns, Co-ops, and corporate employees will be in office in a hybrid capacity. Employees will work in the office on designated days, Monday - Thursday, and work remotely Friday.

Title: Program Manager, Virtual and Cabinetry Design Services
RoleDescription:
Must be onsite in Boston, MA (Monday-Thursday)
The salary range for this position is $100,000 - $110,000 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units will be provided as part of the compensation package.
Wayfair is seeking a highly motivated Strategic Program Manager to lead our Virtual and Cabinetry Design Services programs. This role will be instrumental in shaping the future of how customers project shop with Wayfair and our family of brands. You'll be responsible for developing and executing on a comprehensive roadmap, spearheading innovative projects, and partnering with teams like tech and analytics to improve the customer and designer experience. This role comes with a direct report, with the potential to build the team out more as the business grows. 
What You'll Do

Strategic Road mapping: Develop and champion a clear, long-term strategic roadmap for the virtual cabinetry and interior design business, identifying key opportunities for growth, market differentiation, and customer experience enhancements. This includes defining new service offerings, technology requirements, and operational efficiencies. 
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner closely with various teams, including product management, engineering, analytics, marketing, and category management, to ensure seamless execution of strategic initiatives. You'll be the central point of contact for all virtual cabinetry and interior design efforts, driving alignment and accountability across departments.
Team Leadership & Development: Lead a high-performing team of associates, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement. You'll be responsible for setting clear goals, providing regular feedback, and supporting professional development.
Field Support: Support designers and managers in the field by developing a deep understanding of the design process and designer pain points, clearing roadblocks, and providing feedback on program performance. Business Performance Management: Monitor and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess the health and growth of the virtual cabinetry and interior design business. You'll identify trends, pinpoint areas for improvement, and implement data-driven strategies to optimize performance.
Market & Customer Insights: Stay abreast of industry trends, competitive landscapes, and evolving customer needs in the design and home improvement space. Translate these insights into actionable strategies to grow our design business.

What You'll Need

5+ years of experience in business development, product management, strategy, or a related field, with a proven track record of driving growth in a fast-paced environment.
Prior experience managing and developing a team.
Demonstrated ability to develop and execute strategic roadmaps, with a strong understanding of how to translate vision into actionable plans.
Exceptional cross-functional collaboration skills, with the ability to influence and align diverse stakeholders.
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a data-driven approach to decision-making.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex ideas clearly and concisely to all levels of the organization.
Experience in e-commerce, home furnishings, interior design, or a related industry is a plus.

Wayfair believes everyone should live in a home they love. Through technology and innovation, Wayfair makes it possible for shoppers to quickly and easily find exactly what they want from a selection of more than 15 million items across home furnishings, decor, home improvement, housewares, and more. Title: Facilities Manager
RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $99,425-$105,425 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units will be provided as part of the compensation package.
 
We are Wayfair; we deliver a best-in-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customers needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. Weve been busy building a best-in-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset-based warehouses. We are looking for talented hard-working individuals to join our growing team  your professional home awaits you at Wayfair in our state of the art Fulfillment Center in Lathrop, CA
What Youll Do

As the Facilities & Maintenance Manager, you will coordinate the maintenance and repair of the entire Distribution Center and all equipment in the building, including conveyors, Material Handling Equipment (MHE), Powered Industrial Trucks (PIT), electrical systems, fire and security systems.
You will act as day-to-day primary authority on repair and maintenance and manage personnel assigned to technical, as well as, maintenance positions.
Youll provide guidance and direction to department managers and maintenance department employees in the areas of customer service, loss prevention, safety, expense control, electronics, mechanical conveyor repair, and lift truck systems.
Youll possess extensive knowledge of the FC layout and flow of product, and be a lead technician skilled in electronics, mechanical conveyor repair and lift truck systems. PLC knowledge is helpful.
You will interface with Management regarding ongoing projects and coordinate maintenance of the facility equipment to meet the needs of the building including coordinating outside contractors that may be required to work in the building.

What Youll Need

5+ years of experience in facilities maintenance management in a distribution center.
Must have experience with Conveyors, MHE, PLC's, Electrical, Plumbing and Fire/Security
Experience with CMMS (Computerized Maintenance Management System) in managing work orders, inventory, and reporting.
Ability to perform physical activity including, but not limited to, sitting, standing, bending, stooping, lifting (up to 50 lbs.), and walking.
Ability to maneuver through storage racks, trailers, and other areas of the warehouse.
Ability to operate equipment found in a distribution center environment including, but not limited to, material handling equipment, and the ability to use office equipment including, but not limited to, phone, keyboard, monitor, and calculator.
Must have effective communication skills both in person and on the computer via other meeting services.
Ability to develop and manage a budget around existing or new facility needs. 
The environmental requirement of the position consists of working indoors in an average office environment 20% of time and in a warehouse environment 80% of time.
Understanding of complex blueprints and construction specifications is a plus.
Exposure with industrial safety including: confined space, electrical, Lock-Out/Tag-Out and other is a plus.

 
Benefits

Competitive Salary
Employee discount on our website

Title: Software Engineer II, Customer Technology
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who we are 
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently. 
Wayfair's Search and Recommendations team builds the core platforms and services that allow our customers to discover & buy the products they love. Just last year alone our team has contributed to hundreds of millions in incremental revenue. We do this by leveraging Wayfair's extensive customer and product data to deliver trusted and valuable recommendations in real-time using custom machine learning models. We productionalize these ML models as microservices and build data pipelines necessary for inference and model training.
Our platforms and services are used to power experiences for search, browse across multiple  storefront and marketing channels and are called over a billion times a day. 
We're looking for an experienced software engineer to join our highly impactful team to help us build and extend our Storefront team. A Software Engineer will be responsible for high quality implementation and consistent maintenance of systems that support auto-complete search behavior on Wayfair's sites. We have ambitious goals to improve this search functionality to better understand customer intent and map them to the most relevant products and searches on site.
Work cross-functionally with different roles and your team, such as product management, core areas of the business to understand the problems we need to solve, and solution against them in a globally distributed environment.
What You'll Do:

Collaborate cross-functionally with product managers, UX designers, and backend engineers to understand business problems and translate them into responsive and performant front-end solutions.
Build scalable, maintainable, and highly interactive user interfaces using ReactJS, JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML5, and CSS3.
Work with RESTful APIs and ensure seamless data integration with backend services.
Use version control tools like Git for collaborative development and efficient release cycles.
Create and optimize cross-browser and cross-platform compatible applications.
Participate in writing unit tests and maintaining test coverage using tools like Jest or React Testing Library.
Contribute to full-stack development as needed using Java (Spring Boot) and SQL, particularly for understanding and integrating front-end components with backend services.
Collaborate in Agile teams and contribute to sprint planning, code reviews, and continuous improvement practices.
Utilize CI/CD pipelines and tools such as Jenkins, Docker, or Kubernetes to ensure reliable delivery of front-end applications.
Document technical solutions and maintain up-to-date knowledge of front-end best practices.

What You'll Need:

24 years of professional experience in front-end development using ReactJS and modern JavaScript (ES6+).
Strong understanding of HTML, CSS3, TypeScript, and responsive design principles.
Familiarity with backend technologies such as Java (Spring Boot) and experience writing or debugging SQL queries.
Experience integrating front-end components with REST APIs or GraphQL services.
Solid understanding of front-end state management patterns (e.g., Redux, Context API).
Basic understanding of containerised deployment environments such as Docker and Kubernetes.
Experience working with cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure is a plus.
Knowledge of modern development tools and build systems (Webpack, Babel, NPM/Yarn).
Familiarity with Agile methodologies and DevOps practices.
Strong communication and collaboration skills to work across teams.
Good documentation skills for writing and maintaining technical specifications and project artifacts.

Nice to Have:

Familiarity with monitoring/logging tools like Elasticsearch, Grafana, or Prometheus.
Understanding of messaging systems like Kafka or Redis.

Title: Commercial Strategy Associate - Early Careers (Summer 2025 Start)
RoleDescription:
Summer 2025 start 
Location: Boston, MA
Additional Details:

This is a Boston based opportunity with a 4 day in office expectation (Monday - Thursday) with 1 day remote (Friday).
At this time, Wayfair will not sponsor applicants for employment authorization for this position for the following work visas: STEM OPT EAD, H-1B, H-1B1, E-3, O-1, J-1, or TN

Wayfair is continuing to expand our commitment to hiring and supporting talent early in their careers, focusing on filling opportunities with experienced graduates who have 1-3 years of experience.
Who We Are:
Wayfairs Commercial organization delivers on Wayfairs promise to help everyone anywhere create their feeling of home through building an unparalleled selection, driving tangible value, and ensuring a seamless customer experience. This team builds strong relationships with suppliers to provide true partnership in helping customers create a space that reflects who they are and what they need. They attract, grow, and retain Wayfairs customer base through innovative marketing strategies. This team curates and refines product collections to enhance and optimize the shopping journey. As an Associate, youll develop and execute strategies that generate competitive advantages for Wayfair, and the results of your findings will improve the end-to-end supplier and customer experience.
What Youll Do:

Analyze data and trends to improve the quality of our product catalog in order to increase customer satisfaction, trust, and site conversion rates; researching categories and vendors to build out selection
Create cross-functional partnerships to advance your category and suppliers through merchandising, promotions, marketing, on-trend product selection, effective pricing and profitability, and operational excellence
Create and enforce best practice guidelines to enrich product assortment, optimizing processes to enable high quality & efficiency while guaranteeing an easily digestible experience for suppliers & internal stakeholders
Build key supplier relationships to enable successful negotiations and push towards a best-in-class customer experience
Leverage data to analyze the competitive environment, report on performance trends, and develop business cases for strategic initiatives
Represent Wayfair at various offsite events such as trade shows
Manage communication with internal and external stakeholders

What Youll Need:
Basic Qualifications:

1-3 years of transferable experience in a corporate environment, including internship and co-op experience
You must be authorized to work in the United States without visa sponsorship by Wayfair now or in the future

Preferred Qualifications:

Analytical mindset able to process large volumes of data using a variety of reporting tools (Excel, Google Sheets, SQL, etc.)
Ability to distill complex information in a simplistic way via emails, charts, graphs, and other forms of presentations
Passionate about execution with a strong interest to drive customer engagement
Desire to own projects from beginning to end, and thrive as part of a team as well as individually
Comfortable navigating a fast-paced, dynamic environment Strong project management and prioritization skills

As a Commercial Strategy Associate, youll join our teams that are driving Wayfairs best-in-class online customer experience. Youll be responsible for owning and maintaining Wayfairs vast e-commerce catalog, executing strategy for product categories and managing supplier relationships, and continually improving the customers on-site shopping experience. 
Possible Team Placements Include:
B2B
Wayfair Professional (aka Wayfair B2B) is an industry leading business to business sales organization dedicated to help businesses make good spaces great. Wayfair Professional is the gated experience of Wayfair dedicated to all business customers. We organize our customer base and corresponding offering (site and sales) into 7 industry verticals, prioritizing our Interior Design, Commercial Office and Contractor experiences. We are on a journey to being a $5B+ business by 2025 (+30% YoY growth), with over a $300B opportunity to cover across North America and Europe over the subsequent 10 years.
Catalog Health
In this role, you will own offshore operations, manage inbound requests, and oversee the supplier and product delisting process, ensuring a healthy and trustworthy catalog that abides by our Code of Conduct. You will work cross-functionally with Business and Technology teams to improve operational workflows, identify opportunities for efficiency, and inform key business strategies. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, is a problem-solver with strong communication skills, and enjoys collaborating with multiple stakeholders to drive impactful results. This is a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in e-commerce operations, working closely with cross-functional teams to improve catalog health and drive efficiency at scale. If you are a proactive problem-solver with a passion for operational excellence, wed love to hear from you!
Catalog Merchandising
The Global Merchandising organization is responsible for building and maintaining Wayfairs e-commerce catalog of over 24 million+ products. The organization consists of multiple teams who each play a crucial role in defining and executing on best-in-class merchandising. The Global Merchandising teams guide the management of our enormous product catalog and provide suppliers with tools to continually expand our product assortment. The Merch teams drive product discovery, consideration, and purchase on all of our stores and marketing channels by ensuring customers have complete, accurate, and relevant product information, and by removing friction for suppliers to provide it. The Data Integrations & Analytics teams leverage Big Data to optimize internal merchandising processes. Together, these teams deliver on key merchandising goals. 
Category Management
The Category Management team drives strategy for Wayfairs product categories through tight internal and external partnership. We serve as ambassadors of the product categories we manage. We are at the forefront as Wayfair redefines the supplier experience as a platform, giving suppliers more data, more transparency, and more control while retaining the high-touch elements that make working with Wayfair exceptional. Internally, we leverage a diverse set of cross-functional partners to execute our strategic vision. In a role on the Category Management team, you will be expected to define overarching goals and strategy within your category, problem-solve, articulate and execute against tactical plans, and manage key business metrics. Members of the team must be able to expertly negotiate internally and externally, while also being effective project managers.
Merchandising Compliance
Our Merchandising Compliance team is responsible for keeping our customers safe, and our products, services and offerings in compliance with applicable federal or local regulations. We support those efforts through building efficient processes and scalable technology solutions. If youre passionate about driving business impact by working cross functionally, love working through complex operations decisions, and thrive in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment, then this is the perfect opportunity for you.
North America/Europe Retail Tech Analytics 
The North America/Europe Retail Tech Analytics Team empowers stakeholders across the Global Supplier Organization, enabling teams to grow their businesses. As an associate you would help streamline processes, organize internal and external communication with regard to program updates, new tools, etc, and work closely with data to draw conclusions and influence stakeholders.
Perigold 
Perigold is Wayfairs newest brand, targeting the luxury home market. We are focused on providing an unparalleled assortment of luxury home goods through an elevated online shopping experience for our customers. We do this by connecting the best brands with our luxury customers while working on product curation, brand marketing and storytelling, building a best-in-class site experience, and providing best-in-class service and delivery. We serve as ambassadors for the categories we manage by identifying and solving unique customer and supplier challenges. Internally, we partner with various teams including Profit Management, Merchandising, Partner Operations, Marketing, Brand and Curated Merchandising and Promotions to bring the Perigold vision to life.
Scalable Purchasing, B2B Customer Enablement Team
Wayfairs B2B and Global Sales teams support Wayfair Professional and high-value Sales customers. The Customer Enablement (CE) team designs and implements customer-centric experiences that add value for our B2B and Sales customers. We serve customers via a gated site experience that is tailored based on a given customers vertical (e.g., Commercial Office, Interior Design, Contractor). The Scalable Purchasing team within Customer Enablement is focused on enabling transactional shopping behavior at scale: meeting business customers wherever they are. Focused on both digital transformation and change enablements required to meet customers needs. We seek a motivated associate with a leadership mindset who will partner with vertical leaders and customer enablement team members to optimize the customer journey to consistently exceed revenue targets and improve the customer experience. This role will help to implement transformative projects to enable scalable purchasing at large. Some examples of this include: enabling E-procurement &amp; Financing unlocks for B2B customers. The role will report to the Scalable Purchasing Lead and partner directly with cross-functional teams (B2B CM, Sales Tech, Revenue Operations, B2B Finance Operations, Fintech &amp; Sales Teams) to drive overall customer journey improvements. This includes proactively partnering with analytics to monitor performance and improve how we identify / prioritize customers, designing and implementing step-change improvements to the customer journey, and driving cross-functional projects that optimize the site-, sales-, or marketing treatment.
Supplier Advertising & Merch Services
The Supplier Advertising team sells and advocates the use of our advertising suite of products to our supplier base. We help suppliers stand out on site and amplify their exposure off site. The team is focused on driving: the maximum performance for every dollar a supplier spends with us and significant high margin revenue to Wayfairs bottom line.
Supplier Inventory Management
On the Supplier Inventory Management team, we partner with thousands of suppliers to maximize customers experience. This means driving speed and availability through supplier inventory and positioning strategies, leveraging both Wayfairs fulfillment services (CastleGate) as well as suppliers existing supply chains. On this team, you'll have a "COO" mindset, and be responsible for individual supplier and category inventory strategy, including integrating with Wayfair's e-comm and physical retail.

RoleDescription:
The base pay for this position is $89,100 to $110,000 per year. If you live in Boston, the base pay will be $99,000 - $110,000 per year. Senior Creative Strategist  Performance Creative
This is a remote work position with travel expected for quarterly in-person meetings and conferences. The position can also be a hybrid in-office role that works out of our Boston HQ (Tuesday - Thursday in office, Monday/Friday remote).
Wayfairs Performance Creative team is seeking a data-driven Senior Creative Strategist to lead the development of innovative, insight-led ad creative across paid social and digital channels. This is a key role at the intersection of storytelling, design, and data, focused on producing high-performing creative that drives measurable impact across the funnel on platforms like Meta, Pinterest, YouTube, TikTok, and beyond.
As part of a fast-paced, cross-functional team, youll collaborate with performance marketers, designers, editors, and data analysts to translate business goals into compelling customer-facing creative. You will own end-to-end campaign ideationfrom research and messaging strategy to creative testing and optimizationensuring every asset we launch upholds brand integrity, follows channel best practices, and is built to convert.
This role is ideal for a creative strategist with 5+ years of experience in performance-driven environments who thrives on balancing storytelling with experimentation, and can bring structure and strategic clarity to a high-volume creative pipeline.

Own the Creative Strategy for Paid Campaigns: Lead strategy for ad creative across key paid channels including Meta, Pinterest, YouTube, TikTok, Paid Search, and programmatic. Develop insight-driven concepts tailored to platform behavior, audience mindset, and performance goals.
Drive End-to-End Campaign Development: Develop compelling creative concepts, messaging frameworks, and testing roadmaps grounded in insights. Support Seasonal Campaign Launches: Collaborate with the Go-To-Market (GTM) team to influence and direct seasonal campaign creative, ensuring assets are optimized for paid channels and grounded in SEO insights while identifying content gaps. 
Mentor and Inspire: Help guide designers by providing actionable feedback, moodboards, and strategic direction. Champion experimentation, iteration, and scrappy production methods to maximize learning velocity.
Leverage & Repurpose Assets: Strategically utilize existing lifestyle, studio, 3D, and UGC video and static assets to scale output efficiently across channels while maintaining creative effectiveness.

What You'll Need:

5+ years of experience concepting, writing, and producing direct response ads in a fast-paced and high volume environment, such as a digital marketing agency or an in-house growth team, ideally in e-commerce or DTC.
1+ years of experience working directly with paid media (Meta, Pinterest, YouTube, etc.) as a media buyer or equivalent role, with a clear understanding of how creative impacts performance.
Experience with Facebook Ads Manager, creative testing tools, and performance reporting dashboards
A proven ability to develop and scale direct response creative that drives measurable results.
Deep understanding of platform-specific creative best practices, including Meta, Pinterest, YouTube, TikTok, and other emerging formats.
Strong creative instincts with a focus on clarity, conversion, and audience empathy.
Experience working with graphic designers, video editors, content creators, and production teams to ship high volumes of content.
Familiarity with testing methodologies, performance metrics, and using data to guide creative iterations.
Strong organizational skills and the ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects across different stakeholders and timelines.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to guide copywriters on scripts, headlines, and performance-oriented copy.
Comfort working in a hybrid, collaborative environment that values speed, curiosity, and creativity.

Portfolio or examples of past campaigns, especially those tied to performance metrics, are highly encouraged.
Bonus:

Experience with creative automation platforms or modular content systems for the consistent production of a high volume of creative assets
Prior experience in retail, home, or lifestyle categories
Interest and knowledge of cutting-edge technology such as AI-generated content and VO

RoleDescription:

Who We Are:
At Wayfair we are well on the way to becoming the worlds number one, online destination for all things home. Our core belief is that everyone should live in a home they love. Lead the next phase of GenAI-powered creative optimization and automation to drive significant incremental ad revenue and improve supplier outcomes.
Raise technical standards across the team by promoting best practices in ML system design and development. 
Partner cross-functionally with Product, Engineering, and Sales to deliver scalable ML solutions that improve supplier campaign performance. Ensure systems are designed for reuse, extensibility, and long-term impact across multiple advertising workflows.
Research and apply best practices in advertising science, GenAI applications in creative personalization, and auction modeling. Keep Wayfair at the forefront of innovation in supplier marketing optimization.
Collaborate with Engineering teams (AdTech, ML Platform, Campaign Management) to build and scale the infrastructure needed for automated, intelligent advertising decisioning.

Title: Software Engineering Manager, App Aquire & Activate
RoleDescription:
Engineering Manager - App Acquire & Activate (Toronto TDC)
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Toronto, Canada and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
 
Wayfair believes everyone should live in a home they love. Through technology and innovation, we make it possible for shoppers to quickly and easily find exactly what they want from a selection of more than 14 million items across home furnishings, dcor, home improvement, housewares, and more. Partnering with Product, Experience Design, Analytics, and business leaders across Wayfair, our Native App Engineering teams contribute to an award-winning mobile experience that makes shopping for your home delightful and engaging. iOS and Android engineers leverage the full capabilities of mobile devices and their SDKs. For example, our apps take advantage of augmented reality, computer vision-assisted product search using the devices camera, and machine learning to create personalized experiences and improve the speed of the app.
 
The App Acquire & Activate team charter is to facilitate smooth onboarding of customers and continuous engagement and retention during our customers shopping and home project lifecycle by creating new value propositions for the Wayfair App Experience designed to serve the needs of early lifecycle and low-purchase intent users. The ideal candidate has experience in native app development (iOS or Android), and a proven track record of managing stakeholders and external partners. Experience or general interest in modern native application development techniques, Artificial Intelligence and GraphQL is a big plus!  This person will leverage their breadth of knowledge in these areas to lead and grow a multi-disciplinary engineering team that delivers features for Wayfair shoppers to make their shopping experience frictionless and delightful.
 
What You'll Do

Lead a team of iOS and Android developers working on features and tech that powers our native apps shopping experience.
Promote, coach, and drive a high quality culture into the team and organization
Proactively manage critical project issues, risks and challenges, utilizing project management tools and business expertise to deliver projects.
Lead and drive engineering initiatives from inception to development, and deployment. Initiatives may cut across multiple aspects of the applications.
Work closely with product management and business stakeholders to understand and translate business objectives into technical solutions.
Represent the engineering team in cross-functional projects and to the company at large.
Utilize strong leadership skills to build the best high performing team.
Coach, mentor, and keep 1:1 with team members as well as gather feedback and implement necessary improvements.
Ensure high quality and performance standards for the Wayfair mobile platform.
Oversee the definition of best practices and coding standards across the entire team; review code and provide guidance for other code reviewers participating in our release approval process.  
Use data and metrics to collaboratively drive impactful changes across the application; work closely with product and engineering management to anticipate areas for improvement and investment, and highlight these for inclusion in the team's project roadmap.

What You'll Bring

At least 3+ years of engineering leadership or management experience
At least 7+ years of software development experience with ideally 3+ years of native app development (iOS or Android)
Experience in either Swift or Kotlin in building mobile applications with a desire to continuously learn as you strive to develop and improve your team.
Knowledge of mobile software design patterns and experience working with a variety of architectures.
Experience recruiting, managing, fostering and retaining talent on a technical team.
Agile experience and extensive experience working on an agile development team.
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.
High level of accountability, bias to action and a desire to empower individuals on the team to perform at their best.
Focus on team building and collaboration over individual performance.

 
How will you be challenged?
As an engineering manager you will be a technical leader working hand in hand with your product counterpart in setting the direction for one of the most impactful development teams in the Wayfair app development organization.  As we continue to grow, we have been tackling challenges of launching and supporting multiple apps, modularizing our code, and achieving feature parity across Android, iOS, web, and mobile web.  We seek managers who are comfortable leading these efforts and building on the existing foundation of our award winning Wayfair app.
 
The base pay for this position is $207,700 - $228,771 CAD annually. The base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.

Title: Recruiter, Wayfair Stores
RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $60800-$69,588 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
The role will be based out of our new Wayfair store in Atlanta, GA and will be onsite Monday through Friday. This role requires some flexibility to work occasional weekends or in-store events.
At Wayfair, we believe great people build great teams, and that starts with you. As our Recruiter you'll be the primary engine behind our store's talent strategy, ensuring were hiring the right people, at the right time, for the right roles. Youll build strong partnerships with store leaders, understand the unique needs of each department, and deliver a candidate experience that reflects our brand: welcoming, helpful, and a little playful.
This role is equal parts relationship-builder, problem-solver, and brand ambassador. Youll manage everything from traditional and creative sourcing, to screening candidates and offer letters, to candidate onboarding details and process changes. All of this, while constantly staying two steps ahead of the hiring curve. If you thrive in fast-paced and changing environments, love connecting people to purpose, and take pride in creating seamless hiring experiences, this role could be your professional home.What Youll Do:

 Own Onsite Recruitment: You will primarily serve as the face of Talent Acquisition in the store, working onsite five days a week to build strong, in-person relationships with stakeholders, hiring managers, and future team members.
 Understand the Business Inside & Out: Develop a deep understanding of each hiring manager and department, including Logistics, Visual, Sales, Design, Operations, and Asset Protection, to deliver qualified talent aligning with both role requirements and team culture.
 Source Strategically & Creatively: Leverage tools like Avature, GEM, Visier, and Greenhouse along with creative, boots-on-the-ground sourcing efforts. You will use this to build strong pipelines, generate quality applicant flow, and attract talent in both expected and unexpected places.
 Own Job Postings and ATS Accuracy: Create, update, and maintain job postings with precision while ensuring the applicant tracking system remains accurate, organized, and optimized for hiring success.
 Deliver Exceptional Hiring Experiences: Champion clean, consistent, and positive candidate and hiring experiences that reflect Wayfairs values from start to finish.

 Balance Priorities with Precision: Manage competing demands across multiple roles and departments through smart prioritization, clear communication, and confident decision-making, understanding your return on investment.
 Drive Stakeholder Alignment: Build trust quickly, manage feedback, interview loops, and align cross-functional partners toward shared hiring goals, while surfacing key insights and trends to your TA Leadership Team.
 Adapt and Iterate: Embrace feedback, adjust to change, and continuously improve the hiring process by solving challenges and bringing forward fresh ideas.

Youll Thrive in this Role if You Have:

 Stakeholder Relations: You build trust quickly and can partner confidently with hiring managers across departments to deeply understand who and what they need on their teams.
 Sourcing Creativity: You bring fresh ideas to the top of the funnel and are comfortable with boots-on-the-ground recruiting, as well as  using tools like Indeed, GEM, and social platforms to spark applicant flow and uncover hidden talent.
 Recruiting Experience: You have 1+ years of experience in a high-volume corporate or agency recruiting environment and are eager to continue growing your TA expertise.
 Detail Discipline: You are highly organized while moving fast, keep systems clean, follow through flawlessly, and know how to juggle shifting priorities with ease while remaining in accordance with deadlines in a high-volume environment.
 Clear and Confident Communication: You communicate with clarity and professionalism across varying audiences that may require different approaches or messaging.
 Growth-Ready Mindset: Youre adaptable, take feedback in stride, and bring a proactive, can-do attitude to change and new challenges.
 In-Person Energy: This is a fully on-site role, and you shine in face-to-face environments where building in-person relationships makes a lasting impact.
 Talent-Spotting Everywhere: You believe great talent is all around us and treat every interaction as a potential recruiting opportunity, whether its during a shift, a store visit, or out in the community.
